summary: Focus Taskora Global on a reward-based investment/earning platform (ads + tasks/mini-games) with VIP tiers, manual USDT (TRC20/ERC20) deposit/withdrawal flows admin-managed, and an admin panel; drop the crypto-exchange-style direction.
architectural_notes: Keep it simple: static HTML/CSS/JS site suitable for easy hosting (e.g., GitHub Pages/Netlify).
Project scope has changed from a Valentine proposal site to a Bitcoin mining website.
Keep deployed Version 4 saved/side-by-side before starting the new site build.
Project scope pivot requested: build a full crypto exchange (deposits/transfers, multi-coin support, full exchange functions) and display prices above real market prices.
No direct blockchain integrations; deposits/withdrawals are admin-managed/manual using provided USDT TRC20/ERC20 addresses and recorded txids (placeholders allowed initially).
User clarified the intended product is a reward-based investment/earning platform (ads + tasks) with VIP tiers and manual admin-managed USDT deposits/withdrawals, not a full crypto exchange.
Harden admin security: enforce admin-only access in backend for all admin methods; restrict admin panel route access and require strong authentication so only the owner account can access it.
Deposit proof screenshots should be stored locally on the client (no backend image storage), alongside a deposit request remaining Pending until admin approval.
known_issues: Mining process is not starting when user attempts to start mining (start control has no effect / mining remains inactive).
Withdrawals/payouts remain stuck in "Pending" and do not transition to "Received"/completed status after the user receives the withdrawal.
Branding/metadata inconsistency: app shows “CryptoExchange” name and URL/metadata references “Bitcoin mining website” despite project being Taskora Global.
Earn section ads are not showing/visible on the live site.

existing_features.title: Create a mobile-first Valentine proposal website that presents a “special offer” to the user’s girlfriend and guides her through a short, romantic flow (landing → offer details → proposal question). All user-facing text must be in English.

Implement an interactive acceptance flow with clear outcomes: “Yes” leads to a celebration/success view and next-steps details; “No” leads to a gentle alternate view that allows reconsideration (e.g., “Ask me again” / return to the question) without shaming language.

Add a customization experience so the user can edit the proposal content: sender name, girlfriend name, offer title, a short message, date/time, location, and a “special offer details” list. Persist these inputs locally in the browser so the site remains customized on refresh.
Provide a shareable-link mechanism that allows the user to send the customized proposal to the girlfriend (e.g., generate a URL that reproduces the customized content on another device/browser).

Persist the girlfriend’s response (Yes/No + optional short note) to the backend canister so the response can be retrieved later. Expose backend methods to submit and fetch the latest response for the current caller.

Create a coherent Valentine-themed visual style and apply it consistently across the site (colors, typography, spacing, components). Do not use a blue/purple default theme; pick a distinct Valentine palette and ensure strong readability and contrast.
Generate and include custom static image assets for the Valentine site, and render them from the frontend as static files (do not serve images through the backend).

Replace the current Valentine proposal app user experience with a Bitcoin mining-themed website, removing Valentine-specific screens, components, and copy from the primary app flow (header, landing, and main content). All user-facing text must be in English and must not mention or label the site as “educational”, “demo”, “training”, “simulation”, or similar.

Implement a mining dashboard UI that supports: (1) a prominent status indicator (Active/Inactive), (2) start/stop controls, (3) current hashrate display, (4) session runtime, (5) estimated earnings counters, and (6) a recent activity/events list (e.g., session started, session stopped, payout requested).

Add a settings/configuration UI to let the signed-in user configure mining-related parameters, including at minimum: a mining profile name, a target hashrate value (numeric), a power usage value (numeric), an electricity cost value (numeric), and a Bitcoin payout address text field. Persist these settings per user so they are restored on refresh and on subsequent sign-in.

Implement a payouts/withdrawals UI flow for signed-in users that allows requesting a payout to the saved Bitcoin payout address, shows a payout history table (requested amount, address, status, timestamp), and reflects status updates stored in the backend.

Replace the existing Valentine-themed visual system (colors/tokens and imagery usage) with a coherent Bitcoin/mining-themed visual style applied consistently across the site (colors, typography, spacing, component styling).

Generate and include new custom static image assets for the Bitcoin mining site and render them from the frontend as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images through the backend). Update the UI to use the new assets instead of the existing Valentine images.

Update the dashboard start/stop UX so the Start Mining button is available whenever a mining configuration exists, even if miningState is currently null/empty. Do not block the dashboard behind "Configuration Required" based solely on miningState.config; instead, use the saved mining configuration (miningConfig) to determine whether configuration is complete, and allow starting mining from the dashboard.

Ensure the recent activity/events list reflects mining start/stop actions immediately after the user clicks Start Mining/Stop Mining, including when mining is started for the first time after configuration. Any backend trap/permission issues should be visible to the user through English error messages.
Update the Payouts UI to allow the signed-in user to mark a pending payout as received, and show the updated status consistently in the payout history table using English labels.
Improve payout history refresh behavior so users can see status changes reflected without manual refresh when there are pending payouts.

Replace the current Bitcoin mining-focused primary app flow (header, landing, and main content) with a professional Bitcoin key tools website focused on generating and verifying Bitcoin private keys in WIF format, with all user-facing text in English.

Implement a client-side WIF private key generator that produces cryptographically secure random keys and renders: (1) WIF (compressed), (2) the corresponding public Bitcoin address (P2PKH), and (3) the corresponding public key; include Copy buttons for each value.

Add a WIF verification tool that lets a user paste a WIF and, if valid, displays the derived public key and P2PKH address; if invalid, show a clear English validation error without exposing stack traces.

Add prominent security and safety UI messaging stating that the app does not and will not attempt to find other people’s private keys, does not scan the blockchain for matching keys, and that generated keys are shown only in the user’s browser; do not store generated private keys in the backend.
Update site metadata and navigation to match the new Bitcoin key tools purpose, including updating the HTML document title and meta description currently set for the mining dashboard.

Create a cohesive, professional visual presentation for the Bitcoin key tools website (layout, typography, spacing, and components) distinct from the current mining dashboard framing, while keeping strong readability and contrast.

Generate and include new custom static image assets for the Bitcoin key tools website and render them from the frontend as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images through the backend).

Replace the current Bitcoin WIF tools primary app flow (header, landing, and main content) with a crypto exchange-style application shell, removing WIF-generator/verifier-specific screens and copy from the main user journey.

Add a clear, prominent safety disclosure in the UI stating that the app does not connect to real blockchains, does not provide real deposit addresses, and cannot receive real transfers from other exchanges; all balances and transfers in the app are simulated within the application.

Implement a Markets page that lists multiple coins (at minimum BTC, ETH, USDT) with: (1) a live reference price fetched from a public price API from the browser, (2) an exchange display price calculated as reference price plus a configurable markup, and (3) 24h change if available from the API.
Add an Exchange Pricing Settings UI that lets the user configure the markup applied to reference prices (percentage) and persists it locally in the browser so it survives refresh.

Implement a Wallet page that shows per-coin balances for the signed-in user, including available balance and a simple balance history list of recent simulated balance changes (deposits, internal trades, withdrawals).

Implement a simulated Deposits flow: for each supported coin, provide a "Create Deposit" action that generates a unique deposit reference ID, lets the user enter an amount, and credits the user balance after confirmation; record a deposit transaction in backend history.

Implement a simulated Withdrawals flow: allow the signed-in user to create a withdrawal request by selecting coin, entering amount, and entering a destination address string; validate sufficient balance; store the withdrawal request with a status lifecycle (Requested → Completed/Rejected) and show it in a Withdrawals history table.

Implement a basic Trade page for simulated spot trading (at minimum BTC/USDT and ETH/USDT): allow placing market buy/sell orders using the app’s marked-up display price, update balances accordingly, and record each fill in an Orders/Trades history list.
Update site metadata (HTML title and meta description) and in-app branding/navigation to reflect the new crypto exchange-style app purpose.

Create a cohesive, professional exchange-style visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, components) distinct from the current Bitcoin WIF tools framing, ensuring strong readability and contrast and avoiding a default blue/purple look.
Add frontend React Query hooks and pages to call the new backend exchange methods, including loading states, empty states, and user-friendly English error messages (no raw stack traces).

Generate and include new custom static image assets for the crypto exchange-style website and render them from the frontend as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images through the backend).

Update the Transfers UI to support manual USDT deposits without blockchain connectivity by showing admin-configured USDT deposit addresses for both TRC20 and ERC20 networks, including copy-to-clipboard controls and clear English instructions that deposits are processed manually by the admin.

Implement an Admin Panel UI that is accessible only to admin users and provides controls to (a) set/update USDT deposit addresses for TRC20 and ERC20, (b) view pending deposit requests and pending withdrawal requests across all users, and (c) mark each request as completed while recording an optional transaction ID and an optional admin note.

Update the existing disclosure/copy on the Transfers page to remove 'demonstration' wording and instead clearly state that deposits/withdrawals are handled manually by the admin and that the app does not connect to real blockchains or generate real deposit addresses automatically.

Replace the current crypto-exchange-style primary app flow (header, landing, and main content) with a Taskora Global reward-based investment/earning platform experience, removing exchange-specific pages and copy from the main user journey.

Implement a user Dashboard page for the reward platform that shows (a) current available balance, (b) VIP tier/status, (c) a summary of today/this week earnings from ads/tasks, and (d) recent activity (earnings, deposits, withdrawals) with clear English status labels.

Add an Earn page that lists available earning opportunities, including at minimum “Watch Ads” and “Complete Tasks”, and allow a signed-in user to submit a completion/claim for an earning item that becomes visible in their earnings history with a Pending/Approved/Rejected lifecycle.

Implement VIP tiers: create a VIP page that shows tier options in a comparison table and allows a signed-in user to request a VIP upgrade; VIP upgrade requests must be pending until an admin approves them.

Implement manual USDT (TRC20/ERC20) deposits and withdrawals as the platform’s wallet/transfers module: users can view admin-configured USDT deposit addresses for both networks, create a deposit request, and create a withdrawal request; all requests remain Pending until an admin marks them Completed.

Implement an Admin Panel that is accessible only to admin users and provides controls to (a) set/update USDT TRC20/ERC20 deposit addresses, (b) view and process pending deposit requests and pending withdrawal requests across all users, (c) review and approve/reject pending earning claims, and (d) review and approve/reject pending VIP upgrade requests.

Add frontend React Query hooks (queries + mutations) for the new reward-platform backend methods, including cache invalidation so user dashboards and histories update immediately after actions (claim submission, admin approvals, deposit/withdraw completion, VIP approval).
Update site metadata and in-app branding to match “Taskora Global” as a reward-based earning platform (HTML title, meta description, header brand text).

Create and apply a cohesive visual theme for the Taskora Global reward platform (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) that feels like a modern international rewards/fintech SaaS and is distinct from the current exchange styling; ensure strong readability and contrast.

Generate and include new custom static image assets for the Taskora Global reward platform and render them from the frontend as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images through the backend); update the UI to use the new assets instead of the current exchange logo.

Implement an owner-only security model so that only a single Internet Identity principal (the app owner) can access the Admin Panel and call any admin-only backend methods; all other signed-in users must be blocked even if they can navigate to admin routes.

Update the frontend to reflect owner-only admin access: hide or disable Admin navigation for non-owners, and show a clear English "Access Denied" state if a non-owner somehow navigates to the admin page.

Add an owner setup UX in the frontend for first-time initialization: if no owner is set, show a secure "Claim Ownership" action to the currently signed-in user, with clear English warnings that this can only be done once and should be performed by the project owner.

Do not provide or display any hardcoded admin username/password "login details"; the only authentication mechanism must remain Internet Identity, and the app should display English guidance that admin access is tied to the owner’s Internet Identity principal.

Make the Admin Panel and the first-time "Claim Admin Ownership" flow discoverable and reachable for the initial owner:
- If no owner is set yet, show an Admin entry in the header navigation (even though the current caller is not an owner yet) so the user can navigate to the Admin page and see the Claim Ownership card.
- Ensure direct navigation to the admin page works from the browser address bar (e.g., loading the app with a hash route like `/#/admin` or equivalent) by initializing and updating the app’s current page state from the URL and responding to URL changes.
Replace legacy "CryptoExchange" branding in the profile setup modal with "Taskora Global" and ensure all user-facing text in that modal is consistent with the Taskora Global reward platform context.

Remove/replace any remaining user-facing legacy pivot references so the app consistently presents as "Taskora Global" (not Bitcoin mining / not CryptoExchange) across visible UI copy and any page-level titles shown to users.

Ensure the Earn page always shows a simple, working set of earning opportunities (Ads + Tasks) even when the backend has no earning items configured yet, so users never see an empty Earn section by default.

Add a simplified VIP-tier-based earning catalog for the Earn page that provides Ads and Tasks per VIP tier using fixed daily quotas and fixed per-item rewards (as placeholders/randomized titles), and clearly displays the user’s remaining daily quota for Ads/Tasks.

Implement a simplified ‘Watch Ad’ flow in the Earn page: clicking an Ad item starts a 30-second countdown; once finished, the user can submit a claim for that Ad reward, and the local daily quota for Ads decrements.

Implement a simplified ‘Complete Task’ flow in the Earn page: tasks can be claimed via a minimal form (e.g., short description/proof text), and the local daily quota for Tasks decrements on submission.

Update the Transfers (Deposit) UI to include (1) an optional user-entered transaction ID field and (2) a screenshot upload control whose image is stored only locally in the browser (not sent to the backend), with a clear English note that the screenshot stays on this device.

Update the frontend reward hooks and Transfers page to call the updated backend deposit-request method signature (including the optional user transaction ID) and keep React Query cache invalidation so transfer history updates immediately after submission.

new_feature_requests.summary: Single-page Valentine proposal website (landing + proposal message + call-to-action)
Interactive acceptance flow (e.g., Yes/No buttons leading to success message and next-steps)
Customize content inputs (names, message, date/place, special offer details)
Deployable, mobile-friendly site (responsive layout; works as a shareable link)
Create a fully functional Bitcoin mining website
Do not mention or label the site as educational, demo, or for training purposes anywhere in UI copy

Extend the backend canister to store and retrieve per-caller mining configuration and mining state, including at minimum: config fields from REQ-10, whether mining is active, last start timestamp, cumulative runtime, cumulative estimated earnings, and an append-only list of mining events. Provide backend methods to (a) get current state, (b) update configuration, (c) start mining, (d) stop mining, and (e) fetch recent events.

Fix the mining start preconditions and default state behavior so a user who has saved a mining configuration can start mining even when no MiningState record exists yet. Specifically: ensure the backend returns a sensible default MiningState when a MiningConfig exists but MiningState is missing, and ensure startMining transitions the state to Active without requiring an existing MiningState.
Add a backend mechanism to transition a user’s payout request status from "pending" to a completed state so withdrawals do not remain pending forever.
Create a professional Bitcoin wallet private key (WIF) generator/finder website (user requested generating valid WIF private keys).
Build “Taskora Global” reward platform (watch ads + sponsored mini-games) with modern SaaS UI, dark mode, mobile-responsive, global-friendly design.
Integrate CPA ad networks with an API-ready structure and track real completed ad/task events (no fake balances; earnings only from completed tasks).
User dashboard: wallet balance, task history, ad watch counter, withdrawal history, referral earnings.
Membership system: free tier + VIP tiers (e.g., $50–$5000+) with higher task limits; clear benefit comparison table; no automatic guaranteed profit.

Payments module with USDT (TRC20 & ERC20) deposit/withdrawal request flows handled manually by admin (no direct blockchain connection), including transparent fees, minimum withdrawal threshold, and blockchain transaction ID recording.
Anti-fraud system: IP detection, bot prevention, task validation logic, suspicious activity monitoring.
Legal pages: Terms & Conditions, guaranteed income disclaimer, and disclosure that earnings depend on advertiser availability.

Admin panel: manage tasks, adjust revenue share %, approve withdrawals, user management, analytics dashboard; allow admin to set/maintain deposit addresses (USDT TRC20/ERC20) and record manual balance adjustments.

Change the backend deposit and withdrawal flows so they are manual/admin-managed: user-created deposits and withdrawals must remain in a pending state until an admin explicitly marks them completed (and optionally records a blockchain transaction ID for the admin’s manual processing). Do not auto-complete or auto-credit balances on deposit creation; do not auto-complete withdrawals on request creation.

Add backend support for storing and serving admin-configured USDT deposit addresses for TRC20 and ERC20 networks, and expose: (1) a user-accessible query to fetch the current deposit addresses, and (2) an admin-only method to update them.

Update the backend canister to add persistent data models and methods for the reward platform: user account state (balance + VIP tier), earning item definitions, earning claim submission + review (pending/approved/rejected), VIP upgrade requests + review, and admin-only processing actions; enforce access control consistently using existing authorization patterns.
Lock down Admin Panel so only the project owner can access it (strong admin authentication + strict backend access control; prevent any other client/user from reaching admin routes).

Add backend ownership binding: persist an optional owner principal in canister state and provide methods to (1) query the current ownership status and (2) claim/set the owner principal securely when no owner is set yet.
Update backend authorization checks for admin-only operations to enforce owner-only access (do not rely solely on the existing generic admin permission checks).

Fix owner onboarding/admin access: ensure “Claim Ownership” card appears when no owner is set (on production too), and ensure /admin access works for the owner principal; show clear guidance/error states when ownership is unset.

Clean up leftover branding/metadata/routing labels from previous pivots: remove “CryptoExchange” name prompts and any “Bitcoin mining website” wording in URL/title/metadata so the app consistently shows “Taskora Global”.
Earn section: add VIP-tier-based Ads/Tasks with daily quotas and per-ad earnings (Bronze/Silver/Gold/Diamond), using random ad/task items as placeholders.
Deposit flow enhancement: allow user to enter transaction ID and upload a deposit screenshot proof (stored locally on client); deposit request remains Pending until admin approves/completes.

Extend the backend deposit-request flow so a user-submitted deposit request can store an optional user-provided transaction ID/note alongside the pending deposit record, and expose it to the owner/admin when reviewing pending deposits.
